wikipedia_page.main: Job Wilding (1862 – 15 March 1947) was a Welsh international footballer. He was also among the first full-time professional football players in England.He made his international debut on 14 March 1885, in the Wales versus England match at Leamington Road, Blackburn. He was also Everton F.C.'s first player to represent Wales at full international level.

link_mentions.page: List of Everton F.C. international players
response: Everton's first international was Job Wilding who appeared for Wales against England on 14 March 1885. The most recent newly capped player is Ben Godfrey for England against Austria on 2 June 2021.
|1885–86 British Home Championship|| Bill Roberts, Job Wilding, Richard Hersee, Thomas Bryan, Herbert Sisson || 700
